Sentencas: A dynamic internal reforming-solid oxide fuel cell system model is developed and used to simulate the coproduction of electricity and hydrogen while meeting the measured dynamic load of a typical southern California commercial building.
Titulo: Feasibility of solid oxide fuel cell dynamic hydrogen coproduction to meet building demand

Sentencas: The simulated direct internal reforming-solid oxide fuel cell (DIR-SOFC) system is controlled to become an electrical load following device that well follows the measured building load data (3-s resolution).
Titulo: Feasibility of solid oxide fuel cell dynamic hydrogen coproduction to meet building demand

Sentencas: The feasibility of the DIR-SOFC system to meet the dynamic building demand while co-producing hydrogen is demonstrated.
Titulo: Feasibility of solid oxide fuel cell dynamic hydrogen coproduction to meet building demand

Sentencas: The resulting thermal responses of the system to the electrical load dynamics as well as those dynamics associated with the filling of a hydrogen collection tank are investigated.
Titulo: Feasibility of solid oxide fuel cell dynamic hydrogen coproduction to meet building demand

Sentencas: The DIR-SOFC system model also allows for resolution of the fuel cell species and temperature distributions during these dynamics since thermal gradients are a concern for DIR-SOFC.
Titulo: Feasibility of solid oxide fuel cell dynamic hydrogen coproduction to meet building demand
